title: MD
biography: Lal Krishna Advani is an Indian politician and statesman who served as the Deputy Prime Minister of India from 2002 to 2004 under then Prime Minister of India Atal Bihari Vajpayee. He is one of the co-founders of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and a member of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), a right-wing Hindutva organisation. He was the longest serving Minister of Home Affairs serving for 6 years and 64 days from 1998 to 2004, until his protége Amit Shah overtook him in 2025. He is also the longest serving Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha, as well as the longest serving President of the BJP, the current ruling party of India. He was the BJP's prime ministerial candidate during the 1989, 1991, and 2009 general elections.
aiSummary: G. K. Rath is a national cancer grid expansion specialist with an H-index of 41 at National Cancer Institute (Jhajjar)Oncology (Member). Has been published in The Lancet Planetary Health, The Lancet Oncology, The Lancet Global Health. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
